title: Arctic broadband satellites complete key tests ahead of mid-2024 launch
summary: Two satellites designed to bring mobile broadband coverage to the Arctic region for civilians and military users have completed key tests ahead of their planned launch next summer.

title: Satellite imagery reveals explosion at China’s Jiuquan spaceport
summary: A Chinese launch vehicle maker appears to have suffered an explosion at a test site at Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center.

title: ASI Seeks Commercial Operator for Lunar Oxygen Extraction Mission
summary:
The Italian Space Agency (ASI) has launched a market research notice to gauge the interest of commercial operators in running the agency’s lunar regolith oxygen extraction mission. Even with the potential for affordable super heavy-lift capabilities offered by launch systems like Starship, in-situ resource utilization will still be a key element of a sustained human […]
The post ASI Seeks Commercial Operator for Lunar Oxygen Extraction Mission appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Defense and intelligence contractor Arcfield acquires Orion Space Solutions
summary: Arcfield, a U.S. defense and intelligence contractor, announced Nov. 29 it has completed its acquisition of Orion Space Solutions, a developer and manufacturer of small satellites and sensor payloads.

title: Firefly conducts first Miranda engine test
summary: Firefly Aerospace has conducted the first hot-fire test of a new engine that will power the company’s future launch vehicles.
